metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22067 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition product of Oracle Java SE (component: CORBA). Supported versions that are affected are Oracle Java SE: 8u381, 8u381-perf; Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition: 20.3.11 and 21.3.7. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via CORBA to compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition accessible data. Note: This vulnerability can only be exploited by supplying data to APIs in the specified Component without using Untrusted Java Web Start applications or Untrusted Java applets, such as through a web service. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.3 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

advisory.DiscoveredBy: thiscodecc of MoyunSec TopBreaker Labs and Bing of MoyunSec

criterions.comment: openjdk-13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by openjdk-17').
openjdk-16: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by openjdk-17').
openjdk-8 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
